content: The world's first postage stamp, the Penny Black, was issued by which country in 1840?

The world's first postage stamp, the Penny Black, was issued by the United Kingdom in 1840. It was introduced as part of a series of postal reforms by Rowland Hill, which included the implementation of the Uniform Penny Post system. The Penny Black featured a profile of Queen Victoria and was used for mailing letters weighing up to half an ounce.
